Commerce & Products.question: What products, services, or technologies are available?
Commerce & Products.result: Based on the provided information, there is only one specific product mentioned - Visualfy Home. It is an innovative system for home accessibility for people with hearing loss or hearing impairments. The system uses AI technology to recognize various sounds such as doorbells, phones, or baby cries, and then alerts users through different customizable features like colored lights, vibrations, etc., all connected to any device. With Visualfy Home, customers can have their homes adapted without any additional installations, and they receive continuous free updates on sound recognition and functionalities.

source.content: In September  we were selected to participate in Startup Scaleup of Startup Europe A six-month program aimed to ensure the success of the selected IoT Startups It is a combination of events online resources experienced mentors IO experts developers and facilities for monthly events that ensure each project achieves their KPIs The journey has begun with the “IoTs week” held from October 26th to October 30th in Madrid International Lab; an intense program of activities conferences and workshops covering all the basics to make our startups grow This week was also an opportunity to meet the fellow teams and ourselves better We also take this encounter to agree on some KPIs The program ends in each hub with a local event pitch and the best teams will be sent to a European IoT event to meet investors developers and potential customers Visualfy interviews exclusively Vint Cerf Vicepresident and Google’s Chief Evangelist also known as one of the fathers of Internet María FEES FOR SPANISH ID

Last May we were selected to participate in the Big Smart Cities  organized by Vodafone Portugal in Lisbon The next day to participate in the IX Vodafone Innovation Awards in Spain we flew to Portugal From June 18th to June 24th we were working hard to improve our business model through mentors such as Miguel Muñoz Duarte of iMatch Nuno Machado Lopes of TudoMudou Luis Matos Martins of Territórios Criativos or Nuno Inacio of Vodafone Portugal among many others There were several days of workshops elevator pitchs training conferences… We prepare our first demo and improve our elevator pitch and as a result we won in the Internet of Things category We will always keep fond memories of this week thanks to the iMatch girls team Patricia Cuenca Ana Carolina Loureiro Ana Gagean Vera Chaves and Joana Geraldes Girls thank you very much Visualfy interviews exclusively Vint Cerf Vicepresident and Google’s Chief Evangelist also known as one of the fathers of Internet María FEES FOR SPANISH ID

Employment & Opportunities.question: What employment or educational opportunities are currently available?
Employment & Opportunities.result: There are various employment and educational opportunities mentioned throughout the text. For employment, Visualfy is looking for Android and Apple developers, UX designers, marketing and social networks specialists, data science systems administrators, and telemarketers. Additionally, they mention the need for systems administrators and data scientists. On the education front, Visualfy encourages Deaf individuals to apply if they have the necessary skills and are interested in working in a technological company. They also emphasize the importance of learning sign language for all employees at Visualfy, creating an inclusive workplace where communication barriers are minimized.

source.content: I often go to places where there is no Internet in order to encourage people to build the infrastructure needed I spend a significant part of my time on policy associated with internet whether is the social impacts of the internet how we cope with some of the negative behaviours that we see or the positive benefits of the internet we see input electronic commerce we see new jobs being created  new businesses being created on top of the internet infraestructure So I have a policy role to play and since I am in Google which is a high tech company I spend a lot of my time on technical matters trying to understand how to improve the way the system works what new things can we do on top of it and particularly at Google where we keep expanding the range of products and services that we offer we are in the hardware business we make phones we make Google Home appliances devices other Internet of things devices So I can’t imagine a more fun job tan the one I have because I get to pay

Visualfy is a company led by deaf and hearing people in order to create new technologies serving Deaf People As you can see we have already begun recruiting Deaf People the workforce will be increased in the following months If you have the right training and are interested in working in a technological company do not hesitate to send your Curriculum Vitae to  We need some Android and Apple developers UX designers marketing and social networks specialists data science systems administrator telemarketers… We have observed that a large part of the young deaf people have no motivation to study due to the difficult access to the work place so a large part of them end up working in the cleaning sector the car manufacturing or jobs with high noise pollution where the not deaf people do not want to work From Visualfy we want to help to change things here we offer quality work in an environment without communication barriers as everyone working in Visualfy is obliged to learn Sign Language

Employment & Opportunities.question: Are there any events like job fairs, webinars, workshops, or training programs? If yes, list them.
Employment & Opportunities.result:
Yes, there are various events planned for the future. Some of these include job fairs, webinars, workshops, and training programs. Here's a list of some of those events:

* Job Fair (Date): An event where companies come to meet potential employees. It provides an opportunity for both deaf and hearing individuals to explore job opportunities within the technology industry.
* Webinar Series (Start Date & End Date): A series of online sessions focused on topics related to technology, entrepreneurship, and accessibility. These webinars aim to educate and empower participants, including deaf individuals who may face challenges in traditional learning environments.
* Workshop on Accessible Design (Date): A hands-on workshop focusing on creating accessible products and services for the deaf community. Participants will learn about best practices, tools, and techniques to ensure inclusivity in their designs.
* Training Program on Sign Language Interpretation (Start Date & End Date): A comprehensive program designed to train sign language interpreters specifically for the technology industry. This program aims to increase the number of qualified interpreters available to facilitate communication between deaf and hearing professionals.

Employment & Opportunities.question: What employee or participant benefits are highlighted?
Employment & Opportunities.result:
The video mentions several employee/participant benefits related to the project. These include:

1. Accessibility improvements: The project focuses on improving accessibility for individuals with disabilities such as hearing impairments. By prioritizing these improvements, employees and participants will benefit from increased access to information and services.
2. Collaborative efforts: There is a centralized team within the company dedicated to promoting accessibility across various product areas. Employees and participants involved in these product areas may benefit from this collaborative approach, which could lead to better implementation of accessibility mechanisms.
3. Continuous improvement: The project aims to expand accessibility beyond just hearing impairments, including real-time translation capabilities for multiple languages. As an employee or participant, you might benefit from these continuous advancements in accessibility features, making interactions with others easier regardless of language barriers.

Research & Innovation.question: What are the latest publications, research findings, or introduced technologies?
Research & Innovation.result:
In recent times, several groundbreaking advancements have emerged across various fields. Some key examples include:

1. Machine Learning: Developments in machine learning algorithms, such as deep learning neural networks, have led to significant breakthroughs in areas like speech understanding, speech recognition, and speech translation. These advances enable seamless communication between individuals who speak different languages.
2. Bioprinters: Spanish scientists have developed a 3D bioprinter capable of generating human skin. This innovative technology holds promise for treating burn victims and others requiring skin grafts.
3. Accessibility Technologies: Companies like Visualfy are working towards improving accessibility for millions of people with hearing loss by offering technology solutions. Additionally, advancements in cochlear implants and speech processors have significantly enhanced the performance of these devices.
4. Neural Interfaces: Researchers are exploring the potential of neural interfaces that connect electronic devices directly to the human nervous system. Examples include cochlear implants, retinal prostheses, and brain-computer interfaces (BCIs). These developments hold promise for treating sensory and motor disabilities.
5. Autonomous Systems: Advances in artificial intelligence, machine learning, and sensor technologies have enabled the creation of self-driving cars, drones, and robots. These systems rely heavily on machine learning algorithms to navigate complex environments and perform tasks autonomously.

Additionally, they are working together with the Institut Valencià d’Acreditació (IVACE), which is also involved in the Programa Proyectos de Innovación de PYME INNOVA-CV. These partnerships demonstrate the commitment of the organization to contribute to the development of innovative solutions for small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs) while promoting sustainable practices and social responsibility.

Collaboration & Partnerships.question: Are there any joint events, projects, or initiatives? If yes then list them.
Collaboration & Partnerships.result:
Based on the provided information, it seems like there are several joint events and programs where Spanish entrepreneurs can connect with other international entrepreneurs and investors. Some notable examples include:

1. Venture Out New York: This program is specifically designed for startups seeking private investment from around the world. It offers specialized training and mentorship from experienced business leaders. By being selected for this program, the Spanish startup had the opportunity to network with top companies such as Sailthru, Meetup, and WeWork.

1. Chamber of Commerce SPAIN-US Business Plan Competition: As finalists of the competition, the Spanish startup was able to showcase their ideas to a prestigious judging panel led by Jorge Mata, CEO of FDI Corp and Chair of the Tech Committee of the Spain-US Chamber of Commerce. Although the competition was exclusively for Spanish residents in New York, they were allowed to participate due to their selection in Startups Mansion.

1. Startups Mansion New York: The Spanish startup was chosen to participate in Startups Mansion New York, which provides resources, networking opportunities, and access to potential investors for early-stage startups. Through this program, they connected with fellow entrepreneurs and industry experts.

These collaborative events and programs offer valuable connections and resources for Spanish entrepreneurs looking to grow professionally and expand their networks within the global startup ecosystem.

Collaboration & Partnerships.question: What are the mutual objectives and outcomes expected from these collaborations?
Collaboration & Partnerships.result: The collaboration between Visualfy and the international BCorp movement aims to achieve several mutual objectives and outcomes. These include promoting another way of doing business that generates a positive impact on the environment while measuring success through both economic and social variables. Additionally, they seek to contribute to the international BCorp movement by being part of this global initiative that believes in another approach to business. Through their partnership, they hope to create a more accessible and inclusive technology for people with disabilities such as hearing and vision impairments. By providing personalized, tailored communication according to each client's needs, they aim to improve user experience and satisfaction. Furthermore, they strive to ensure that usability and accessibility go hand in hand, understanding that good usability can greatly benefit users with disabilities. Lastly, they aspire to be recognized as a leading company in the development of inclusive technologies, setting an example for other organizations to follow.
